alert.note: Alert for Black Hawk; Grundy; Hardin; Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 7:52PM CST until February 18 at 10:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Wintry Precipitation Gradually Coming to an End, Windy Conditions Continue... .A cold front continues to push across Iowa this evening with wintry precipitation along this front. Although precipitation has ended in northern Iowa, any wet roads could become icy as temperatures have fallen below freezing. In central Iowa, rain and snow showers will continue along the front ending later this evening with slick spots possible as temperatures continue to fall. Strong wind gusts out of the northwest have increased behind the frontal passage but will gradually decrease into the overnight hours. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Strong gusty winds and wintry precipitation. Total snow accumulation less than an inch, but winds gusting from 35 to 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central Iowa. * WHEN...Until 10 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slick road conditions. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Any wet roadways could become icy and slick this evening as temperatures fall below freezing.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 5 1 1 app or dial 5 1 1.
